item.title: Reply to a comment by hmhrex on 'Webfaction “has joined forces with “GoDaddy' on /r/webdev at https://reddit.com/r/webdev/comments/9j2bl1/webfaction_has_joined_forces_with_godaddy/eidvk0d/:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to a comment by hmhrex on 'Webfaction “has joined forces with “GoDaddy' on /r/webdev at https://reddit.com/r/webdev/comments/9j2bl1/webfaction_has_joined_forces_with_godaddy/eidvk0d/:

I’m looking at Digital Ocean pricing, the price they quote for each ‘droplet’, that’s all I have to pay? I don’t want something that’s pay-for-what-you-use like AWS

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description: It’s 2017 and IE is still the browser with the most #webdev issues. (Gap has narrowed though compared to the IE6 days)
